title: Logicblocks
description: The core building block. Each logicblock combines conditions and actions into a single automation rule. Name them, tag them, organize them by room or project.

title: Complex conditions
description: Combine multiple conditions with AND, OR, and NOT logic. "If I'm home AND it's after sunset AND the front door sensor triggered" — one rule, not three.

title: Multiple triggers
description: A single logicblock can be triggered by different events — a sensor update, a schedule, a webhook, or an IFTTT applet.

title: Multiple actions
description: One rule can control several devices and services at once. Turn on the lights, adjust the thermostat, and send a notification — all from one trigger.

title: Condition sources
description: Build conditions from time, location, device states, sensor data, IFTTT triggers, Tuya events, or webhook inputs. Mix and match freely.

title: Action delays
description: Delay individual actions within a logicblock. "Turn on lights now, close blinds in 30 minutes, adjust thermostat in 1 hour" — all from one trigger.

title: Cron expressions
description: Schedule logicblock evaluations with cron precision. Every 5 minutes, every weekday at 7am, the first Monday of each month — whatever you need.

title: Sunset & sunrise
description: Time conditions that adapt to your location and the season. "Between sunset and midnight" just works — no manual adjustment needed.

title: Timeouts
description: Reset a condition after a set period. If your motion sensor doesn't report "no motion" reliably, a timeout handles it. Prevents false triggers from flaky sensors.

title: Time windows
description: Restrict when automations are active. "Only on weekdays", "only between 22:00 and 06:00", "not on holidays".

title: Auto-import
description: Connect your Tuya, Hue, Sonoff, or Tado account and your devices appear automatically. Real-time status updates, no manual configuration.

title: Custom devices
description: Create your own virtual devices with boolean, string, or numeric attributes. Track states like "vacation mode", "guest count", or "last watered".

title: Device-centric dashboard
description: Devices are the primary entry point. See all your hardware at a glance, grouped by room, project, or integration.

title: Tagging & grouping
description: Tag devices, logicblocks, and variables. Filter your dashboard by tag. Manage a whole room or project as a unit.

title: Broad compatibility
description: Tuya covers thousands of white-label products. Sonoff/eWeLink covers WiFi and Zigbee. Hue for lighting. Tado for heating. Alexa for routines. IFTTT for 600+ more brands.

title: Normal mode
description: The default. Conditions met → actions run. Fully automatic, no intervention needed.

title: Warning mode
description: Apilio notifies you before executing. You get a window to cancel. Useful for high-impact automations like locking doors or turning off heating.

title: Suggestion mode
description: Apilio evaluates conditions but waits for your manual confirmation before acting. You stay in the loop for sensitive routines.

title: Override
description: Temporarily disable automations. Hosting a party? One toggle pauses all your lighting routines until you re-enable them.

title: Event log
description: See every trigger, condition evaluation, and action execution in real time. Understand exactly what happened and when.

title: CSV export
description: Download your event history for analysis. Debug complex automations or track patterns over time.

title: Email notifications
description: Get notified when specific logicblocks fire or conditions change. Up to 300 emails/month on higher plans.

title: Centralized view
description: One place for all devices, all brands. No switching between Tuya, Hue, and Tado apps to understand your system.

title: Web & mobile
description: Access Apilio from any browser, any device. Check status, adjust settings, review logs — from anywhere.

title: REST API
description: Full JSON API. Read and write variables, query condition states, trigger logicblock evaluations. Token-based authentication. Documented on Postman.

title: Incoming webhooks
description: Every variable and logicblock gets its own unique URL. Update values, trigger evaluations, activate or deactivate logicblocks — from any external system.

title: Outgoing webhooks
description: When actions fire, Apilio can send HTTP requests to any URL. Custom headers, body, and authorization. Variable values injected into requests.

title: Extensibility
description: Works with iOS Shortcuts (Siri), Tasker, Zapier, Locative, Life360, Node-RED, Home Assistant, or anything that can make an HTTP request.

title: Real-world uses
description: SMS via ClickSend, smart locks via Nuki, push via Pushover, voice queries via Siri Shortcuts, Android automation via Tasker.
